role_appointments.title: Irfan Siddiq - Ambassador, British Embassy Sudan

body.content:
Irfan Siddiq was appointed Her Majesty’s Ambassador to Sudan in April 2018.


##Curriculum vitae

Full name: Irfan Siddiq OBE

Married to: Penélope Siddiq

Children: 2

2018 up to present Khartoum, Her Majesty’s Ambassador

2017 – 2018 Plan International, International Advocacy Director 
 (secondment)

2016 – 2017 FCDO, Head, Secondment Unit

2013 – 2016 Baku, Her Majesty’s Ambassador

2011 – 2013 FCDO, Head, Arab Partnership Department

2010 – 2011 Baghdad, Deputy Head of Mission

2007 – 2010 Damascus, Deputy Head of Mission

2005 – 2007 FCDO, Private Secretary to the Foreign Secretary

2004 – 2005 Washington, secondment to US State Department as Political Officer

2003 – 2004 Baghdad, Political Officer, Coalition Provisional Authority

2002 – 2003 Cairo, Second Secretary (Political/Press)

2000 – 2002 Full time language training (Arabic)

2000 – 2000 FCDO, Desk Officer, Middle East Peace Process Section

1999 – 2000 New Delhi, Second Secretary (Economic/Commercial)

1998 –1999 FCDO, Desk Officer, NATO

1998 Joined FCDO

Irfan Siddiq was appointed Her Majesty’s Ambassador to Sudan in April 2018.

The Ambassador of Her Majesty The Queen and the UK government in the country to which they are appointed. They are responsible for the direction and work of the Embassy and its Consulates, including political work, trade and investment, press and cultural relations, and visa and consular services.
